data.title: International Calling
data.meta_description: Browse Verizon's long distance calling plans. Whether you make occasional calls or daily check-ins, we have international call options to fit your needs.
data.text:
While you're in the US, you can make calls to another country using your device. If you call other countries only occasionally, you can pay a standard per-minute rate.

Learn how to make an international call when you’re in the US.

If you make such calls frequently, consider getting an international calling plan:

International calling plan details International calling plan Which countries and minutes are included & how to add the plan Global Choice Pick a country and get up to 300 minutes/month depending on the selected Global Choice country. You can add up to 140 countries for $10/line per month per country. Get discounted rates after the allowances to the selected country. Plus, make discounted calls from $0.05/per minute to 220+ countries. And get unlimited minutes to Mexico and Canada.

Add Global Choice to your mobile device's line in My Verizon online, in the My Verizon app or by texting the country's keyword to 4004.

You can find the list of country keywords here.

Notes:

Any existing line level international long distance plan you have will be removed when you add Global Choice.

Any existing account level international plan will be removed from all lines when you add Global Choice to any line on the account.

Global Calling Plus (formerly Unlimited Together World) Enjoy unlimited long distance calls from the US to landline phones in over 60 countries and to mobile devices in over 30 countries. Plus, make discounted calls to an additional 160+ destinations - all for $15/month per line.

Visit our Global Calling Plus page to see countries included with Global Calling Plus and get rates for your calls.

Add the Global Calling Plus plan to your device's line in My Verizon or by texting the word Plus to 4004. Global Calling (formerly Unlimited Together - North America) Enjoy unlimited long distance calls from the US to Mexico and Canada for just $5/month per line. And, make discounted calls to an additional 220+ destinations.

See countries included with Global Calling.

Add the Global Calling plan to your mobile device's line in My Verizon online, in the My Verizon app or by texting the word Global to 4004.

For more details about calling other countries, visit our International Services (while in the US) page and enter a country name to get calling and messaging rate options and dialing instructions.

Note:

Our Unlimited Ultimate mobile phone plan includes 1 Global Choice country.

All Unlimited plans provide unlimited calling to Mexico and Canada. Plus you take your domestic talk, text and data allowances with you to Mexico and Canada at no additional charge. Learn more about our Unlimited plan options.

Yes. We offer 2 different features, International Services Enabled Lite and International Services Enabled, which let you make international calls from your Verizon mobile device.

International Services Enabled Lite - is included with your mobile phone plan and lets you make international calls from the US to all countries, except these:

Excluded Countries - International Services Enabled Lite

Countries

Angola Ascension Island Azerbaijan Congo, Dem. Republic of Congo, Republic of Djibouti East Timor Estonia Gambia Guinea Latvia Liberia Lithuania Maldives Mayotte Senegal Sierra Leone St. Helena

International Services Enabled - You must add this feature to your account if you want to:

Make calls from the US to any of the countries listed above

Make calls when you’re outside the US (except for calls back to the US or calls within the country you're in)

To add International Services Enabled, contact us. Your account must be active for at least 34 days* and must be in good standing to add this feature.

To place a call while in the US to a country that uses 10-digit dialing, simply enter the 10-digit phone number you want to call, then tap the Call button.

To place a call while in the US to all other countries, you'll start with 011. Next, you must enter the country code, followed by the number you want to reach.

For example, if you'd like to call a number in France:

Enter 011 and the country code 33.

Enter the phone number.

Tap the Call button.

For more information about dialing specific countries, visit our International Service Options (while in the US) page.

For information about placing calls while traveling outside the US, visit our Trip Planner tool.
